oauth_2_0.name: oauth_2_0
oauth_2_0.description:
Body example for authorisation request:

client_id=...&
redirect_uri=...&
response_type=code

Bidy example for token request:

POST Data
client_id=...&
client_secret=...&
redirect_uri=...&
code=...&
grant_type=authorization_code

All requests to the Buffer API must be made using HTTPS, with the access token provided in the HTTP Authorization header, request body or query string.

400.description:
1003  Parameter not recognized.
1004  Required parameter missing.
1006  Parameter value not within bounds.
1012  Profile did not save successfully.
1016  Profile buffer could not be emptied.
1022  Update did not save successfully.
1025  Update was recently posted, can't post duplicate content.
1026  Update must be in error status to requeue.
1027  Update must be in buffer and not custom scheduled in order to move to top.
1029  Event type not supported.
1030  Media filetype not supported.
1031  Media filesize out of acceptable range.
1032  Unable to post image to LinkedIn group(s).
1034  Cannot schedule updates in the past.
1033  Comments can only be posted to Facebook at this time.
1042  User did not save successfully.

1001  Access token required.
1002  Not within application scope.
1011  No authorization to access profile.

1015  Profile could not be destroyed.
1021  No authorization to access update.
1023  Update limit for profile has been reached.
1024  Update limit for team profile has been reached.
1028  Update soft limit for profile reached.
1051  No authorization to access client.

schedules.name: schedules
schedules.description: Each item in the array is an individual posting schedule which consists of days and times to match the format return by the above method.

methods.description: "Set the posting schedules for the specified social media profile.

application/json.name: application/json
application/json.example:
{
  "total" : 8 ,
  "updates" : [
    {
      "id" : "4ec93ae4512f7e6307000002" ,
      "created_at" : 1320703582 ,
      "day" : "Monday 7th November" ,
      "due_at" : 1320543480 ,
      "due_time" : "07:01 pm" ,
      "profile_id" : "4eb854340acb04e870000010" ,
      "profile_service" : "twitter" ,
      "status" : "buffer" ,
      "text" : "This is me in an alternate life where i can breakdance j.mp/w..." ,
      "text_formatted" : "This is me in an alternate life where i can breakda..." ,
      "user_id" : "4eb9276e0acb04bb81000067" ,
      "via" : "firefox"
    }
  ]
}

page.name: page
page.description: Specifies the page of status updates to receive. If not specified the first page of results will be returned.

count.name: count
count.description: Specifies the number of status updates to receive. If provided, must be between 1 and 100.

since.name: since
since.description: Specifies a unix timestamp which only status updates created after this time will be retrieved.

utc.name: utc
utc.description: If utc is set times will be returned relative to UTC rather than the users associated timezone.

methods.description: "Returns an array of updates that are currently in the buffer for an individual social media profile.

application/json.name: application/json
application/json.example:
{
  "total" : 8 ,
  "updates" : [
    {
      "id" : "4ec93ae4512f7e6307000002" ,
      "created_at" : 1320703582 ,
      "day" : "Monday 7th November" ,
      "due_at" : 1320543480 ,
      "due_time" : "07:01 pm" ,

}

page.name: page
page.description: Specifies the page of status updates to receive. If not specified the first page of results will be returned.

count.name: count
count.description: Specifies the number of status updates to receive. If provided, must be between 1 and 100.

since.name: since
since.description: Specifies a unix timestamp which only status updates created after this time will be retrieved.

utc.name: utc
utc.description: If utc is set times will be returned relative to UTC rather than the users associated timezone.

methods.description: Returns an array of updates that have been sent from the buffer for an individual social media profile.

application/json.name: application/json
application/json.example:
{
  "success" : true ,
  "updates" : [
    {
      "id" : "4eb854340acb04e870000010" ,
      "created_at" : 1320703582 ,
      "day" : "Saturday 5th November" ,
      "due_at" : 1320742680 ,
      "due_time" : "08:01 am" ,
      "profile_id" : "4eb854340acb04e870000010" ,
      "profile_service" : "twitter" ,
      "status" : "buffer" ,
      "text" : "3 Incredible Stories Made Possible Through Twitter j.mp/u..." ,
      "text_formatted" : "3 Incredible Stories Made Possible Through Twit..." ,
      "user_id" : "4eb9276e0acb04bb81000067" ,
      "via" : "safari"
    } , {
      "id" : "4eb854340acb04e870000010" ,
      "created_at" : 1320703582 ,
      "day" : "Saturday 5th November" ,
      "due_at" : 1320742680 ,
      "due_time" : "08:01 am" ,
      "profile_id" : "4eb854340acb04e870000010" ,
      "profile_service" : "twitter" ,
      "status" : "buffer" ,
      "text" : "3 Incredible Stories Made Possible Through Twitter j.mp/u..." ,
      "text_formatted" : "3 Incredible Stories Made Possible Through Twit..." ,
      "user_id" : "4eb9276e0acb04bb81000067" ,
      "via" : "safari"
    }
  ]
}

order.name: order
order.description: An ordered array of status update id's. This can be a partial array in combination with the offset parameter or a full array of every update in the profiles Buffer.

offset.name: offset
offset.description: Specifies the number of status updates to receive. If provided, must be between 1 and 100.

utc.name: utc
utc.description: If utc is set times will be returned relative to UTC rather than the users associated timezone

methods.description: Edit the order at which statuses for the specified social media profile will be sent out of the buffer.

application/json.name: application/json
application/json.example:
{
  "success" : true ,
  "updates" : [
    {
      "id" : "4eb854340acb04e870000010" ,
      "created_at" : 1320703582 ,
      "day" : "Saturday 5th November" ,
      "due_at" : 1320742680 ,
      "due_time" : "08:01 am" ,
      "profile_id" : "4eb854340acb04e870000010" ,
      "profile_service" : "twitter" ,
      "status" : "buffer" ,
      "text" : "3 Incredible Stories Made Possible Through Twitter j.mp/u..." ,
      "text_formatted" : "3 Incredible Stories Made Possible Through Twit..." ,
      "user_id" : "4eb9276e0acb04bb81000067" ,
      "via" : "safari"
    } , {
      "id" : "4eb854340acb04e870000010" ,
      "created_at" : 1320703582 ,
      "day" : "Saturday 5th November" ,
      "due_at" : 1320742680 ,
      "due_time" : "08:01 am" ,
      "profile_id" : "4eb854340acb04e870000010" ,
      "profile_service" : "twitter" ,
      "status" : "buffer" ,
      "text" : "3 Incredible Stories Made Possible Through Twitter j.mp/u..." ,
      "text_formatted" : "3 Incredible Stories Made Possible Through Twit..." ,
      "user_id" : "4eb9276e0acb04bb81000067" ,
      "via" : "safari"
    }
  ]
}

event.name: event
event.description: Specifies a type of event to be retrieved, for example "retweet", "like", "comment", "mention" or "reshare". They can also be plural (e.g., "reshares"). Plurality has no effect other than visual semantics. See /info/configuration for more information on supported interaction events.

page.name: page
page.description: Specifies the page of status updates to receive. If not specified the first page of results will be returned.

count.name: count
count.description: Specifies the number of status updates to receive. If provided, must be between 1 and 100.

methods.description: Returns the detailed information on individual interactions with the social media update such as favorites, retweets and likes.

application/json.name: application/json
application/json.example:
{
  "success" : true ,
  "buffer_count" : 10 ,
  "buffer_percentage" : 20 ,
  "update" : {
    "id" : "4ecda256512f7ee521000004" ,
    "client_id" : "4f850cc93733aa9301000002" ,
    "created_at" : 1320703582 ,
    "day" : "Saturday 26th November" ,
    "due_at" : 1320742680 ,
    "due_time" : "11:05 am" ,
    "media" : {
      "link" : "http://google.com" ,
      "title" : "Google" ,
      "description" : "The google homepage"
    } ,

now.name: now

scheduled_at.name: scheduled_at
scheduled_at.description:
A date describing when the update should be posted. Overrides any top or now parameter. 
When using ISO 8601 format, if no UTC offset is specified, UTC is assumed.

utc.name: utc
utc.description: If utc is set times will be returned relative to UTC rather than the users associated timezone

application/json.example:
{
  "success" : true ,
  "buffer_count" : 10 ,
  "buffer_percentage" : 20 ,
  "updates" : [
    {
      "id" : "4ecda256512f7ee521000004" ,
      "created_at" : 1320703582 ,
      "day" : "Saturday 26th November" ,
      "due_at" : 1320742680 ,
      "due_time" : "11:05 am" ,
      "media" : {
        "link" : "http://google.com" ,
        "title" : "Google" ,
        "description" : "The google homepage"
      } ,
      "profile_id" : "4eb854340acb04e870000010" ,
      "profile_service" : "twitter" ,
      "status" : "buffer" ,
      "text" : "This is an example update" ,
      "text_formatted" : "This is an example update" ,
      "user_id" : "4eb9276e0acb04bb81000067" ,
      "via" : "api"
    } , {
      "id" : "4ecda256512f7ee521000004" ,
      "created_at" : 1320703582 ,
      "day" : "Saturday 26th November" ,
      "due_at" : 1320742680 ,

      "media" : {
        "link" : "http://google.com" ,

  ]
}

profile_ids[].name: profile_ids[]
profile_ids[].description: An array of profile id's that the status update should be sent to. Invalid profile_id's will be silently ignored

shorten.name: shorten
shorten.description: If shorten is false links within the text will not be automatically shortened, otherwise they will

now.name: now
now.description: If now is set, this update will be sent immediately to all profiles instead of being added to the buffer.

top.name: top
top.description: If top is set, this update will be added to the top of the buffer and will become the next update sent

media.name: media
media.description: An associative array of media to be attached to the update, currently accepts link, description, title and picture parameters.

scheduled_at.name: scheduled_at
scheduled_at.description:
A date describing when the update should be posted. Overrides any top or now parameter. 
When using ISO 8601 format, if no UTC offset is specified, UTC is assumed.

utc.name: utc
utc.description: If utc is set times will be returned relative to UTC rather than the users associated timezone
